intro: Amischotolype hispida, commonly known as the rough amischotolype, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amischotolypaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape and have a distinctive pubescent surface. Amischotolype hispida is primarily found in tropical and subtropical regions of Southeast Asia.
